Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <valerianb> Hey guys, was just reading about Comodo algorithm

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <valerianb> I found a source that says Komodo use delayed Proof of Work

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <valerianb> What is that?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <TensaZangetsu2> its Proof of Work but delayed :)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <valerianb> Why is it delayed?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <valerianb> 60 seconds block time

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <valerianb> And enormous TPS capacity

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <valerianb> What is the block size of Komodo network?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <valerianb> A secondary blockchain, so it's something like lightning network?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[telegram] <Regnar> Komodo created an algorithm called dPoW which uses a system of notarizations to Bitcoin to fortify KMD chain integrity. KMD is mined using the Equihash algorithm and like all blockchains it abides by the "Longest chain" rule, however, Komodo adds an additional criteria that must be met. The hash of the Longest chain must also match the most recent notarization made to Bitcoin.
So if someone were to try and 51% attack KMD and reverse a transaction that has already been notarized, then there is no way for them to maintain the correct Hash and therefore match the notarization. So they could release a chain that is far longer than the main chain, however because it doesn't match the notarization, all the nodes will ignore it. (re @valerianb: Why is it delayed?)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <Regnar> This security feature also has a ton of ancillary benefits, for example these notarizations made nSPV possible and exclusive to Komodo ecosystem that uses dPoW. nSPV is a new ultra light weight wallet that can even work with IoT, websites, and embedded devices. It uses thousands of times less resources than traditional SPV wallets.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <Regnar> dPoW also allows Komodo to protect other 3rd party chains. They can notarize their chains to KMD and protect themselves from 51% attacks as well.
